test_name: Slow-Brewed Mode - MRI Brain with Mass
test_description: Tests detailed report generation with comprehensive reasoning for a critical brain finding

inputs.clinical_history: 42-year-old female with new onset seizures and headaches for 2 weeks
inputs.findings: There is a 3 cm enhancing mass in the left frontal lobe with surrounding vasogenic edema. Midline shift of approximately 5 mm to the right. Mild compression of the left lateral ventricle.

expected_results.detail_level: Comprehensive with detailed anatomical descriptions and reasoning
expected_results.critical_findings: Should flag mass effect and midline shift as urgent findings

verification_steps: Verify critical findings (mass effect, midline shift) are prominently mentioned
Ensure detailed differential diagnosis with 5 options
Confirm clinical advice includes urgent neurosurgery consultation
Verify questions address biopsy, treatment planning, and prognosis
Check that template normal findings for posterior fossa are retained
Ensure generation time is within expected range
Verify detailed reasoning for each differential diagnosis
Confirm no contradictions (e.g., 'no mass' vs 'mass present')

success_criteria.accuracy: All critical findings accurately described with measurements
success_criteria.reasoning: Detailed reasoning for each differential diagnosis
success_criteria.completeness: All 5 differential diagnoses with detailed explanations
success_criteria.format: Valid JSON with comprehensive content in all fields

expected_differential_diagnoses.key_features: Ring enhancement, vasogenic edema, mass effect
Solitary enhancing mass, vasogenic edema, need to search for primary
Ring enhancement, clinical correlation with infection history
Less likely without dural attachment but possible
